triples.name: Recommender system
triples.relevance: Recommender systems are the primary application domain that the survey focuses on, involving finding relevant items for users.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: RL is the core machine learning paradigm used to solve sequential decision-making problems in recommendation systems.

triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: DRL combines deep learning with RL to handle recommendation systems with large state and action spaces.

triples.name: Markov decision process
triples.relevance: MDP provides the mathematical framework for formulating recommendation as a sequential decision-making problem.

triples.name: Collaborative filtering
triples.relevance: A traditional recommendation approach that is contrasted with RL-based methods in the survey.

triples.name: Content-based filtering
triples.relevance: A traditional recommendation approach that relies on item features, used as a comparison point with RL methods.

triples.name: Policy gradient method
triples.relevance: Policy optimization is a key component of the RL framework used in recommendation systems.
